Description: Madonna and Child (La Zingarella); Virgin Mary, sitting on the ground, holding the sleeping Child on her lap; above her, an angel, holding palm branches; to the left a white rabbit; against a background of shrubs and trees Engraving, with some etching
Curator's comments: Print after Correggio's Madonna and Child, known as La Zingarella, formerly in the collection of Ranuccio Farnese, now in the National Gallery, Naples. The print shows the state of the panel before the 1934 restoration, which stripped away the angel with palm branches and the rabbit. See Gould, 1976, p. 229-230.
Acquisition notes: From Richard Ford's collection of prints after Correggio (1837,0408.14 to 669), purchased from him through Colnaghi's, for £250.
